definition: private (i.e. not work-related 因公[yin1 gong1])

sentences.english: You can use your private passport for your graduation.
sentences.chinese: 你可以使用你的因私護照。

sentences.english: A palace maid was killed for gossiping about the East Palace story.
sentences.chinese: 一個宮女就因私傳東宮的事被殺了。

sentences.english: Because applies is the private ten year time passport.
sentences.chinese: 申請的是因私十年期護照。

sentences.english: Our company is attached to the professional association of Liaoning exit& entry agency.
sentences.chinese: 公司隸屬於遼寧省因私出入境中介機構行業協會。

sentences.english: So, you would use my private.
sentences.chinese: 你可以使用你的因私護照。

sentences.english: Employees are banned from using company telephone for personal calls.
sentences.chinese: 禁止僱員因私使用公司電話。

sentences.english: Passport valid for at least 6 months;
sentences.chinese: 有效期在6個月以上的因私護照。

definition: in the course of doing one's work/on business
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
main content/matter/work/origin of an incident/cause/purpose/subject (of business letter)
to abscond/to be absent without leave
to know the law and break it (idiom); consciously going against the rules
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
